definition: quatrain (poetic form)
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
variant of 絕|绝[jue2]
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
variant of 勾[gou1]
poetic form consisting of four lines of five syllables, with rhymes on first, second and fourth line

sentences.english: The seven-character quatrain is one of the most representative forms of the Tang poetry.
sentences.chinese: 七言绝句是唐代诗歌中最具代表性的体裁之一。

sentences.english: Xiaoming likes Tang poetry very much, especially its quatrains.
sentences.chinese: 小明喜欢读唐诗，尤其是其中的绝句。

sentences.english: The Ancient Jueju experienced a history course from simple to mature during the period of Wei Jin South and North.
sentences.chinese: 古绝句在魏晋南北朝经历了从稚嫩到成熟的发展历程。

sentences.english: Joking remarks on six quatrains by Du fu has long been the focus of poetic criticism study.
sentences.chinese: 历来对杜甫诗论的研究主要集中在《戏为六绝句》。

definition: poetic form consisting of four lines of five syllables, with rhymes on first, second and fourth line
verse form consisting of 8 lines of 7 syllables, with rhyme on alternate lines/abbr. to 七律
regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
